page.title: 15Housing in Ballantrae.
page.content: Houses in the area all have sanitation and are in good repair.Houses built this century are mostly of brick.A few are built with timber frame and a brick skin.The finish is roughcast. Older houses are of whinstone.Most of them now are covered by roughcast.Some have double glazing and central heating.A large number are two storey. Roofs of the newer houses have various types of tiling.Older houses have slates from quarries-Ballachulish, Cumbria,Westmorland.77 houses were built by Ayr County Council before its demise, 13 of these have now been purchased by tenants.Tenancies are allocated on a points system. There is a police house with office.A new farm building of concrete blocks and Yorkshire boarding,160ft long 65ft wide,is used for wintering sheep and lambing ewes.
